flawed_nl_solution:
She uses 4 hours/day * 125 watts/hour=<<4*125=500>>500 watt hours/day
That means she uses 500 watt hours/day * 7 days/week = <<500*7=3500>>3500 watt hours/week
This is 3500 watt hours / 1000 watts/kw = <<3500/1000=0.35>>0.35 kw hours
So her TV cost 0.35 kw hours/week * $0.14/kw hour = $<<0.35*0.14=0.049>>0.049/week

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3.5, not 0.35. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
